solution.text:
: In given figure the electrician is required to reach the point P on the pole PQ.
Given that :
Height of pole H1 = _{i}_ m.
Height of the vahicle H2 = _{j}_ m.
Angle of elevation A = _{k}_\(^\circ\)
Here, QS represents the distance between pole and vehicle. We need to find its length D.
by similarity we can say that QS = RT.
Now consider the triangle PRT.
In PRT consider tan(A)\(^\circ\).
where, A is angle of elevation of ladder.
So, tan(A) = \(PT\over RT\) ----- eq. (1)
where, PT = PQ - TQ
again, from similarity
i.e., TQ = RS
i.e., TQ = _{j}_
i.e., PT = _{i}_ - _{j}_
i.e., PT = _{{i-j}}_
Now, substituting the value of PT in Eq. 1
We get, tan(_{k}_\(^\circ\)) = \(_{{i-j}}_\over RT\)
i.e., RT = \(_{{i-j}}_\over tan(_{k}_^\circ)\)
i.e., RT = \(_{{i-j}}_\over _{l}_\)
Since, we know QS = RT
So, the distance D between pole and vehicle is equal to \(_{{i-j}}_\over _{l}_\)

content.text: An electrician has to change the led of a street light which is _{i}_ m. above the ground.So for this purpose he uses a municipality repair vehicle that has ladder on it. Height of the vehicle is _{j}_ m. and angle of elevation of ladder attached on top of the vehicle is _{k}_ degree.Find the distance d between the bottom of the street light pole and the repair vehicle.
